item.title: [PDFBOX-2422] PDFont.getStringWidth results in stackoverflow
item.description:
When loading a true type font and calling getStringWidth("é") will result in a stackoverflow. Calling the method with a 'regular' character is ok.

Example code
PDDocument doc = new PDDocument();
// load a font which is in PDFBox
PDTrueTypeFont font = PDTrueTypeFont.loadTTF(doc, getClass().getResourceAsStream("/org/apache/pdfbox/resources/ttf/LiberationSans-Regular.ttf"));
font.getStringWidth("éé");

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This code works fine for me with the latest trunk, can you make sure you're using the latest version from SVN or the latest snapshot jar?

I've updated to the latest code, currently GIT commit a978b29a29629cc461b68f80bd180367e71f980f (12 october 2014). Note that it only occurs when the string contains a special character.
